TopicTitle: I'm really excited about .22 but I am getting married on Saturday..........

Articles.Content:
From youtube I am really looking forward to getting my hands on the .22 version with the new tech tree. I think it will really give some purpose to the game and especially the underused other parts like all the engines.

However, as the title suggests I am getting married this Saturday to the love of my life and as a result I will be away on my honeymoon for a little while and unable to play KSP. Maybe by the time I come back to the UK they will have released a new mini update to fix small problems with .22. I probably wont be able to play until mid November
Congratulations for your wedding. And forget a bit about KSP, and go make your wife happy. If you know what I mean.
Congrats on your wedding man, just forget about it, getting married is a once in a lifetime thing ( well supposed to be) you should enjoy it, KSP will wait
Hopefully the bride doesn't bring a decoupler along on the honeymoon...
Congratulations on the wedding! You should've registered for a laptop perhaps, but KSP will still be here in November

Congratulations on the wedding! You should've registered for a laptop perhaps, but KSP will still be here in November

Or will it? DUN DUN DUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUN!
I think you might be better off being forced to wait. I'm a little wary that they skipped the QA milestone and went straight to Experimentals to satisfy consumer demand.

I think you might be better off being forced to wait. I'm a little wary that they skipped the QA milestone and went straight to Experimentals to satisfy consumer demand.

That is not true at all

See Ted's blog post about QA testing from a while back: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/entries/905-Branching-Out!
Get off KSP for a month, you'll just enjoy it more after your honeymun.

Get off KSP for a month, you'll just enjoy it more after your honeymun.

Take it further and make it a honeyminmus!
Get your priorities right! You can always go on a honeymoon, but .22 only comes out once!
congratulations! and don't worry ksp will be waiting for you and maybe your wife to if you can get her hooked

Get your priorities right! You can always go on a honeymoon, but .22 only comes out once!

This made my night.
well congradulations on getting married. I beat my fear and asked out a girl today...She said she wasn't interested.

Congratulations! May you have a house filled with little Kerbals (well, 3 anyway, so as to fill up a 3 Kerbal pod).

@ leax256: That just means you need to ask out a better looking girl!

That just means you need to ask out a better looking girl!

doesn't help me any, but thanks anyway. better to ask and get rejected than not ask and live in "what if"

Or will it? DUN DUN DUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUN!

I will keep a copy for you

NOW GO GET MARRIED NAO! >
u can do lot of science on honeymoon... if u get my meaning.

I am getting married this Saturday to the love of my life and as a result I will be away on my honeymoon for a little while and unable to play KSP.

So, you're saying KSP is not an acceptable first-night-of-matrimony activity?

Congratulations, and good luck!

u can do lot of science on honeymoon... if u get my meaning.

I would suggest perfect reentry techniques
Congrats on getting married, and don't forget to do science in the bedroom, if you know what I mean

Congratulations on your marriage. May you never decouple. When your Jumbo rendezvous with her clampotron on your marriage's maiden flight, enjoy nights hotter than Kerbol and fill out your Hitchhiker in situ; do a grand tour of the house.

-Duxwing

That is not true at all

See Ted's blog post about QA testing from a while back: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/entries/905-Branching-Out!

I don't think that post says what you think it does.
I don't know how I should feel about this thread with these "jokes"....

I don't know how I should feel about this thread with these "jokes"....

Nobody has yet suggested the proper way to perform marital asparagus staging, so we're safe. Were safe. I think I just ruined it.

Ah, well. Who wants coffee?
